intro: Asperula gemella, commonly known as the dwarf evergreen azalea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Japan and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the spring season. Asperula gemella thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
